            ]

          "type": "code",
          "version": 5
        }

          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["The above alias defines the "],
              ["f", [["c"]]],
              [
                " function, then runs it with any arguments you pass to the alias. So running "
              ],
              ["git ignore .tmp/", [["c"]]],
              [" would add "],
              [".tmp/", [["c"]]],
              [" to your "],
              [".gitignore", [["c"]]],
              [" file."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",

          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["In fact, this pattern is so useful that Git defines "],
              ["$1", [["c"]]],
              [", "],
              ["$2", [["c"]]],
              [
                ", etc. variables for you, so you don’t even have to define a special function for it. (But keep in mind that Git will also append the arguments anyway, even if you access it via these variables, so you may want to add a dummy command at the end.)"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551946597452,
          "parent_id": "29e0b7bc-3826-4e05-a19e-7da9952f5c1e",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["Note that aliases prefixed with "],
              ["\\!", [["c"]]],
              [
                " in this way are run from the root directory of your git checkout, even if your current directory is deeper in the tree. This can be a useful way to run a command from the root without having to "
              ],
              ["cd", [["c"]]],
              [" there explicitly."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
